name: Jeremiah Was a Prophet Multiple Choice Quiz | Jeremiah | 10 Questions

questions.text: According to Jeremiah 1:5 (KJV) how soon does the Lord know us?
options: When he knows who I am I'll let you know
questions.explanation:
Before conception.

	Jeremiah 1:5 "Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee, and I ordained thee a prophet unto the nations."  God is all-knowing so he actually knew us before he even created the world.  The word for being all-knowing is omniscient.

questions.text: What does God command Judah to obey in Jeremiah 7:23 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
His voice.

	Jeremiah 7:23 "But this thing commanded I them, saying, Obey my voice, and I will be your God, and ye shall be my people: and walk ye in all the ways that I have commanded you, that it may be well unto you."  Obeying God is a common theme throughout the Bible. In a Bible search on biblegateway.com for the KJV of the Bible the word "obey" appeared in 114 verses from Genesis to I Peter in the Old Testament.

questions.text: Whose sins are written with a "pen of iron" and a "pit of diamond"?
questions.explanation:
Judah's.

	Jeremiah 17:1 "The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the table of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars." The tribe of Judah was located between the Mediterranean and Dead Seas. (http://www.answers.com/topic/judah-ancient-kingdom-of-southern-palestine?cat=travel)

questions.text: Who is the son of Immer, the priest?
questions.explanation:
Pashur.

	Jeremiah 20:1 "Now Pashur the son of Immer the priest, who was also chief governor in the house of the LORD, heard that Jeremiah prophesied these things."  There was three different Pashur's mentioned in the book of Jeremiah.  The other two are Pashur the son of Malchiah, and Pashur the father of Gedaliah.  However, Wikipedia.com says that the son of Immer may be the same Pashur as the father of Gedaliah, but it is not certain.

questions.text: Who does the Branch refer to in Jeremiah 23:5 (KJV) according to the Christian belief?
questions.explanation:
Jesus.

	Jeremiah 23:5 says, "Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and a King shall reign and prosper, and shall execute judgment and justice in the earth." Jesus was born into the lineage of David through both Mary and Joseph.

questions.text: Who does Jeremiah accuse of lying in Jeremiah 28:15 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Hananiah.

	Jeremiah 28:15 "Then said the prophet Jeremiah unto Hananiah the prophet, Hear now, Hananiah; The LORD hath not sent thee; but thou makest this people to trust in a lie."  Hananiah's name means "gracious". He was a false prophet. It is important to be careful whom you listen to, as some people may be false prophets and therefore dangerous to listen to.

questions.text: What did the king of Babylon take from Zedekiah?
questions.explanation:
his eyes.

	Jeremiah 39:7 "Moreover he put out Zedekiah's eyes, and bound him with chains, to carry him to Babylon." According to Wikipedia, Zedekiah's name at birth was Matanyahu. His name meant "gift of God". Zedekiah means "God is righteous".

questions.text: Where is the Pharoah's home in Jeremiah 43:9 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Tahpanes.

	Jeremiah 43:9 "Take great stones in thine hand, and hide them in the clay in the brickkiln, which is at the entry of Pharaoh's house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah."  Tahpanhes, is on the Suez Canal.  It is located on Lake Manzala in Egypt.

questions.text: What was the judgment on Moab according to Jeremiah 48:47 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
captivity.

	Jeremiah 48:47 "Yet will I bring again the captivity of Moab in the latter days, saith the LORD. Thus far is the judgment of Moab."  The Moabites fought a lot with the Israelites. The capital of Moab was Dibon.

questions.text: What is the last word of the KJV book of Jeremiah?
questions.explanation:
life.

	Jeremiah 52:34 "And for his diet, there was a continual diet given him of the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life." Thank you for taking this quiz. The next quiz will be on Lamentations which is the book of the Bible that follows Jeremiah.
